alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued September 01 at 10:32PM MST until September 01 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 1031 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near South Mountain Park to 6 miles southwest of Sun Lakes to near Bapchule, moving west at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 154 and 183. US Highway 60 between mile markers 173 and 191. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 147 and 175. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Falcon Field Airport, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Seville, Freestone Park, South Mountain Park and Bapchule. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
